physical_examinations.relevant_findings: On admission, the patient exhibited pronounced symptoms of anhedonia, loss of energy, pervasive pessimistic thought biases, sleep disturbances, concentration deficits, feelings of worthlessness and inferiority, and complaints about her appearance. The patient also had moderate myopia and was diagnosed with cachexia (Body Mass Index: 17.75). Additionally, she suffered from a dry mouth, salty taste, and painful oropharyngeal ulcerations typical of Urbach-Wiethe disease.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Compared with a premorbid assessment 7 years earlier, her social network had declined in size from 17 to 10 individuals and in complexity from four embedded networks to one. She exhibited high levels of loneliness (UCLA Loneliness Scale score of 47).

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure not documented.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Severe depression was noted upon admission with respective scores: MADRS (43), BDI (54), C-SSRS (21). Antidepressant response was evident 50 minutes after ketamine infusion with a 73% reduction in MADRS score and a 65% reduction in BDI score by 170 minutes after infusion.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Depressive symptoms returned to baseline after 3 days despite the initial reduction post-ketamine infusion.
